projects.description: List of Tact projects with respective compilation options. Each .tact file represents its own Tact project.

name.description: Name of the project. All generated files are prefixed with it.

path.description: Path to the project's Tact file. You can only specify one Tact file per project.

output.description: Path to the directory where all generated files will be placed.

debug.description:
False by default. If set to true, enables debug output of a contract and allows usage of `dump()` function, which is useful for debugging purposes. With this option enabled, the contract will report that it was compiled in debug mode using the supported_interfaces method.

Read more on debugging Tact code: https://docs.tact-lang.org/book/debug.

masterchain.description: Enables masterchain support in the contract

external.description: Allows the contract to call external functions

experimental.description: Experimental project properties. Might be removed in the future

inline.description: Enables inlining of all functions in contracts. Could reduce gas usage at the cost of a bigger contract
